oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Environmental impacts of organic farming in Europe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stolze, M.
Piorr, A.
H채ring, A.M.
Dabbert, S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
Soil
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic farming has become an important element of European agri-environmental policy due to increasing concern about the impact of agriculture on the environment. This book describes in detail the environmental and resource use impacts of organic farming relative to conventional farming systems, based on a set of environmental indicators for the agricultural sector on a European level. The policy relevance of the results is also discussed in detail.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Stolze, M.; Piorr, A.; H채ring, A.M. and Dabbert, S. (2000) Environmental impacts of organic farming in Europe. Organic Farming in Europe: Economics and Policy, no. Vol. 6. Universit채t Hohenheim, Stuttgart-Hohenheim.
